topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Add a DEA Node to an Existing Cluster

body.p: This example demonstrates how to add a DEA node to a cluster that already exists.

ol.li: Save this content in a text file named bootstrap.ymlfile version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> dea-count: 1 dea-flavor: standard.medium az: <My Availability Zone> Please ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration.

Run the following set of commands.cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v2.0/ ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ --skip-ssl-validation ^ add-role dea ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --load bootstrap_service.yml ^
